caption.p: Dosage regimen and precaution of antiviral drugs in children

tr.th: Dosage regimen of COVID-19 in children

tr.td: Nebulization: using with caution in neonates and infants younger than 2 months

td.p: Nebulization: 200,000–400,000 IU/kg or 2–4 μg/kg in 2 mL sterile water, twice daily for 5–7 days
Spray: 1–2 sprays on each nostril and 8–10 sprays on the oropharynx, once every 1–2 h, 8–10 sprays/day for 5–7 days

tr.td: Contraindication: CrCl < 50 mL/min; histories of mental illness, severe or unstable heart disease, or aplastic anemia

td.p: 7–15: 12 mg/3 mg/kg/time, twice daily for 1–2 weeks
15–40: 10 mg/2.5 mg/kg/time, twice daily for 1–2 weeks
> 40: 400 mg/100 mg/time, twice daily for 1–2 weeks
Contraindication: patients with severe hepatic insufficiency
Not be recommended: children with jaundice
USA and Europe: oral dosage forms ≥ 3 years

tr.td: Intravenous infusion at a dose of 10 mg/kg every time (maximum 500 mg every time), 2–3 times daily
Acute poisoning is usually fatal with a dose of 50 mg/kg
Using with caution in patients with liver dysfunction
